meanings.definition: To write or engrave on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was conscribing her name on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist was conscribing intricate patterns on the clay tablet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel conscribed its territory on the garden fence.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were conscribed in the old journal like a time capsule.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization conscribed their laws on stone tablets for all to see.

meanings.definition: To mark or draw lines on a surface.
meanings.sent1: He was conscribing a path through the maze with chalk.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was conscribing the boundaries of the map on the board.
meanings.sent3: The cat conscribed a playful circle around the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The river conscribed its course through the valley over centuries.
meanings.sent5: The child conscribed a hopscotch grid on the sidewalk with colorful chalk.

meanings.definition: To enlist or recruit for military service.
meanings.sent1: The general was conscribing brave soldiers for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent2: The king conscribed able-bodied men to join the army.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome conscribed the garden gnomes for a secret mission.
meanings.sent4: The call of duty conscribed him to serve his country with honor.
meanings.sent5: The ancient emperor conscribed warriors from all corners of the empire to defend their lands.
